page.title: 01East Hagbourne and district
page.content: Within the area of study there are the villages of East Hagbourne, South Moreton, Aston Upthorpe, Aston Tirrold and part of Blewbury. These are farming communities which date from Saxon times and one farm was in the original Domesday Book. There are two streams which flow through the area; Hacca Brook and Mill Brook, both having considerable influence on the area. There are three primary schools in the area but there is little provision for children below school age and few recreational services in the villages although East Hagbourne seems to be slightly better off than the other villages. Secondary Education is provided in Didcot.
